entityId.localType: State Records Office of Western Australia Reference code

biogHist.abstract: School Journals are the Head Teacher's record of events and activities at a school. Children who were in 'care' at Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home mostly went to the local school, so these journals may give useful information about memorable events in their daily life.
biogHist.p: The Education Department of Western Australia issued journals to the school. In a label inside the book, there were instructions about how to use the journal. Only the Inspectors of the Education Department and the Head Teacher or 'his' assistant were allowed to write in the journal. Regulation 95 of the Education Regulations (1928) said that the school journal should record: causes of low attendance; absence of teachers; results of test examinations; and reasons for departure from the timetable. After the Education Act of 1949 came into effect, Regulation 92 allowed 'comments' about test examinations to be recorded. In practice, Head Teachers had often made comments about tests before that regulation. From 1949, the school journal was also called 'Superintendent's Book or Head Teacher's Suggestion Book or School Journal'.
Quantity: There are three volumes in this series but only two volumes have information about Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: State Archives Collection of Western Australia (1829 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The School Journals created by the Burnbrae government school are part of the state archives collection.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Item 070 - School Journal, Burnbrae Glen, Byford (1948 - 1956)
Item 069 - School Journal, Burnbrae Glen, Byford (1941 - 1947)
State Records Office of Western Australia - Contact Details

descriptiveNote.p: The School Journal [Burnbrae Glen, Byford] has information about the school-related activities undertaken by children at Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home. People who were in Burnbrae may remember some of the events summarised here, from remarks recorded in the journal.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Series S3615 - School Journals', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

archref.repository: State Records Office of Western Australia
archref.abstract: This is a picture of the label that was glued inside the cover of a Burnbrae School Journal. The label has instructions about how to use the journal. The journal was the official record of events at the school so the Education Department tried to regulate the type of things that were written in it.

The journal was the official record of events at the school so the Education Department tried to regulate the type of things that were written in it.

archref.repository: State Records Office of Western Australia
archref.abstract: This is a picture of the front cover of the Burnbrae School Journal. Journals like this were issued to all state schools by the Education Department in Western Australia. This journal can be seen in the State Records Office of Western Australia.
